entity1.name: Environmental Impact
entity1.description: The effect of human activities on the environment, including changes to ecosystems, pollution, and resource depletion.;;;The effect of human activities on the environment, often discussed in terms of pollution, resource depletion, and ecological damage.;;;The effect that human activities, such as industrial production, have on the natural environment, often leading to pollution, resource depletion, or ecological damage.;;;The contamination of the natural environment by harmful substances or factors, leading to adverse effects on ecosystems and human health.;;;A set of methods and strategies aimed at minimizing the environmental impact of the fashion industry by promoting ethical and sustainable production processes.;;;Gases released into the atmosphere that contribute to global warming and climate change, often as a result of industrial activities.;;;The release of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases into the atmosphere, contributing to climate change.;;;A measure of the total amount of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases emitted as a result of an activity or process.;;;The contamination of air and water resources, often resulting from industrial activities or the extraction and processing of materials.;;;A measure of the impact human activities have on the environment in terms of the amount of natural resources used and waste generated.
entity1.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion1;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion21;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion2;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion16;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion18;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion14;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion6;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion12;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion23

entity2.name: Fast Fashion
entity2.description: A business model that emphasizes rapid production and low costs to bring trendy clothing to market quickly, often at the expense of environmental sustainability.;;;A segment of the fashion industry that focuses on producing trendy clothing at a low cost and rapid turnover.;;;A business model that emphasizes rapid production and low costs to bring new trends to consumers quickly.;;;A business model of mass-producing clothing at low cost and rapid turnover to reflect current trends.;;;The global industry involved in the design, manufacturing, distribution, and retail of clothing and accessories.;;;A business model that emphasizes rapid production and low costs to bring new trends to consumers quickly, often at the expense of environmental sustainability.;;;A sector of the clothing and apparel market characterized by mass-produced, trend-driven, and low-cost garments.;;;Companies that produce trendy and inexpensive clothing at a rapid pace, often leading to environmental issues.;;;A sector of the clothing and apparel market characterized by rapid production cycles, low costs, and frequent changes in styles to quickly follow trends.;;;A global business sector involved in the design, production, distribution, and sale of clothing and accessories.;;;A business model that emphasizes rapid production and low costs, often at the expense of environmental sustainability.;;;A business model that emphasizes rapid production cycles to bring new trends to consumers at low prices, often with negative environmental and social consequences.;;;The sector of the economy that deals with the design, production, and marketing of clothing and accessories.;;;A segment of the clothing industry known for producing trendy and inexpensive garments at a rapid pace.;;;Clothing items produced quickly and inexpensively, often following current trends.;;;The sector that encompasses the production, distribution, and sale of goods or services.;;;The process of manufacturing clothing and textiles, often in large-scale factories or sweatshops.

entity7.name: environment
entity7.description: The surroundings or conditions in which an organism or group of organisms lives, including both living and non-living elements such as air, water, soil, and sunlight.
entity7.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion3

entity9.name: non-renewable resources
entity9.description: Natural resources that cannot be replenished or replaced within a human timescale and are therefore finite, such as fossil fuels and minerals.;;;Underground deposits of hydrocarbons, primarily coal, oil, and natural gas, which are used as sources of energy but are non-renewable.
entity9.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion4;;;The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion6

entity11.name: polyester
entity11.description: A synthetic fiber commonly used in textiles due to its durability and low cost.;;;Man-made materials used in the production of clothing and other textile products.;;;A strong, lightweight synthetic polymer fiber widely used in clothing and other applications.

entity13.name: petrochemicals
entity13.description: Chemical products derived from petroleum or natural gas, often used as raw materials for various industries including textiles.

entity16.name: cotton
entity16.description: A natural fiber, often used in the production of textiles and clothing.

entity18.name: deforestation
entity18.description: The action of clearing away forest land, often leading to loss of biodiversity and ecological imbalance.

entity19.name: water scarcity
entity19.description: A condition where the demand for water exceeds its available supply in a region.

entity20.name: pesticides and fertilizers
entity20.description: Substances used to protect crops from pests and enhance plant growth, respectively.

entity30.name: raw materials

entity36.name: cheap labor
entity36.description: Refers to the practice of employing workers at very low wages, often in developing countries.

entity37.name: developing countries
entity37.description: Countries that are less industrialized and have lower standards of living compared to developed nations.

entity42.name: organic materials
entity42.description: Materials derived from natural resources that are grown without the use of synthetic pesticides or fertilizers, often used in eco-friendly products.
entity42.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion18

entity43.name: recycled materials
entity43.description: Materials that have been processed and reused to create new products, reducing waste and the need for virgin resources.
entity43.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion18

entity44.name: efficient production processes
entity44.description: Manufacturing methods designed to minimize resource consumption and waste generation while maintaining or improving product quality.
entity44.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion18

entity45.name: clothing for longevity
entity45.description: A design philosophy that focuses on creating garments that are durable, versatile, and timeless to extend their useful life and reduce the frequency of replacement.
entity45.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion18

entity46.name: Brands
entity46.description: Companies or businesses that produce and sell products, often under a specific name or logo.

entity47.name: circular economy principles
entity47.description: A set of guidelines aimed at minimizing waste and making the most of resources by reusing, repairing, refurbishing, and recycling materials and products.

entity48.name: Consumers
entity48.description: People who purchase and use products or services.;;;Individuals who purchase and use goods and services.

entity49.name: ethical and sustainable fashion brands
entity49.description: Companies that prioritize ethical practices and sustainability in their production processes and supply chains.

entity52.name: resource depletion
entity52.description: The reduction in available natural resources due to overuse or unsustainable practices.
entity52.chunkid: The Environmental Impact of Fast Fashion21

entity53.name: textile waste
entity53.description: Waste generated from the production and disposal of textiles, including fabric scraps and discarded clothing.

entity58.name: sustainable future
entity58.description: A long-term vision of development that meets present needs without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.
